user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n:
```c
bool
MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n (const char *quoted,
                                     size_t quoted_len,
                                     const char *unquoted,
                                     size_t unquoted_len)
{
  size_t i;
  size_t j;
  if (unquoted_len < quoted_len / 2)
    return false;

  j = 0;
  for (i = 0; quoted_len > i && unquoted_len > j; ++i, ++j)
  {
    if ('\\' == quoted[i])
    {
      i++; /* Advance to the next character */
      if (quoted_len == i)
        return false; /* No character after escaping backslash */
    }
    if (! charsequalcaseless (quoted[i], unquoted[j]))
      return false; /* Different characters */
  }
  if ((quoted_len != i) || (unquoted_len != j))
    return false; /* The strings have different length */

  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
bool
MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n (const char *quoted,
                                     size_t quoted_len,
                                     const char *unquoted,
                                     size_t unquoted_len)
{
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the provided fragment: MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n does not call itself (it only calls charsequalcaseless). An indirect recursion violation would only occur if charsequalcaseless (or another function called here) called MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n, which is not shown in the fragment.
